thread.title: Google now shows quietest time to visit a tourist attaction
thread.title_full: Google now shows quietest time to visit a tourist attaction

title: Google now shows quietest time to visit a tourist attaction
text:
Google now shows quietest time to visit a tourist attaction Last updated 10:27, August 19 2015 Supplied 
Kelly Tarltons is one of the most popular tourist attractions in Auckland. 
Google has added a new feature to its search function that helps Kiwis find the best time to visit a tourist attraction. The information comes in the form of a bar chart that appears as part of search results. For example, when searching for Kelly Tarlton's Sea Life Aquarium, just tap "More about Kelly Tarlton's" and a chart will appear showing the busiest times. You can then see at a glance if it's going to be busy when you plan to visit and change your plans if you don't like queuing. It also helps planning ahead, so if you want to visit Auckland Museum on the weekend, it's much quieter on Saturdays than Sundays. READ MORE: How to avoid crowds of tourists 
The feature only works on phones when using Chrome, Safari or the Android browser. 
It only works on some tourist attractions in New Zealand, though the company is planning to add it to more. 
The number of people visiting an attraction is shown as a bar graph in search results. 
Google has rolled out the feature around the world, saying it works for "millions" of places and businesses. 
The company says it will only be available for those destinations where people are curious about how busy it is, which is why tourist attractions are the first to get it in New Zealand. 
The data is gathered anonymously from users of its Google Maps application.
